title: How is tank Ekko healthy for this game?
body:
Pros:
- Amazing survivability 
-Amazing damage
-Amazing engage
-Amazing disengage
-Amazing kiting
-Amazing utility
-Decent AoE
-Amazing passive
-Impossible to kill

Cons:
He has vitiligo on his face.

And, no, 6.8 does not nerf tank Ekko nearly enough.

replies.body:
What made tank Ekko strong was his ability to still deal high amounts of damage without actually building any damage oriented items, Sure he was weaker than  a true tank but if you  were squishy you probably won't be able to duel him.

They lowered his bases and raised his ratios which means he won't have as much damage without actually building damage which not only reduces the effectiveness of building tank but also weakens his early game by a lot especially so given that mana costs are taxing on Ekko. They also weakened his passive slightly while raising the ratios that scale from AP as well. 

While Ekko will still be strong in utility I can see these changes greatly impacting his win rate. Sure he's hard to kill but that's what makes him so strong. His ability to outplay but building magic resist and using CC to stop him right before he ults can win games. 

I don't think Riot's goal is to gut ekko's utility because that's what makes ekko so strong, but rather make it less viable to play as a pure tank than build AP like you would normally as an assassin.
